location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 34/6 Training of Women Teachers in Iraq for the Bahrain Government'

physicalDescription.extent: File is arranged in chronological order, from earliest at beginning of the file to most recent at end.

Condition: The file was formerly bound with treasury tags but these have been removed and its pages are now loose.Foliation: The file's foliation sequence commences at the front cover and terminates at the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and can be found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. Circled index numbers written using blue/red crayon can be found throughout the file.The file contains the following foliation errors: 1, and 1A.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials regarding a proposal to send Bahraini women to a teacher-training school in Iraq.The correspondence identifies the Queen Aliyah institute in Baghdad as being the best such school in Iraq.
